masterpiece-studio.name: Masterpiece Studio
masterpiece-studio.description: Update, maintain and create new features for the web application and APIs
responsibilities: Update, maintain and create new features and components for the web application
Design and develop API endpoints for the web application
Optimize the web application and make it accessibility friendly

impact-depth.name: Impact Depth
impact-depth.description: Visualize citation flow for a publication of interest
responsibilities: Created the citation flow (data-visualization) of each publication's citations dynamically
Manage database and keeping it up to date
Designed and handcrafted the UI/UX
Manage the hosting, analytics and bugs
Add PWA to allow Impact Depth to be installed from a browser to desktop and mobile
Focus on accessibility features to ensure that Impact Depth can be used by as many people as possible, including those with accessibility needs

eplant-plant-efp.name: ePlant's Plant eFP
eplant-plant-efp.description: Designed the updated widget version of the eFP tissue expression viewer for ePlant
responsibilities: Updated ePlant's eFP for Arabidopsis thaliana to be a modular widget
Modified and cleaned up all SVGs to optimize network
Made it simple enough that anyone with access to code-base should be able to add a new compendium

ta.name: Teaching Assistant
ta.description: TA at the University of Toronto for bioinformatics (CSB352) and molecular biology (BIO130)
responsibilities: Taught bioinformatic and biological techniques
Grade students based on given rubrics
Respond to all students at any hour to ensure they understood topics and help troubleshoot issues with their bioinformatic tools

gaia.name: GAIA
gaia.description: Generates a summary or answers a question regarding a gene
responsibilities: Aggregate data from many different repositories, databases, bioinformatic tools and scientific resources
Design and developed a statistical natural-language processing (NLP) approach to broadly answer questions about a gene or gene product
Created custom in-house machine reading (MR) logic to answer questions prompted by user
Code front-end UI
Manage a team of multiple programmers to ensure that GAIA's features are delivered by an expected deadline through iterative/agile development
Focus on accessibility features to ensure that GAIA can be used by as many people as possible, including those with accessibility needs
Worked on data collection, verification and application of a machine-vision model called GeneNet which can detect which figures are genetic models or not

scigrade.name: SciGrade
scigrade.employer: University of Toronto - Human Biology Department
responsibilities: Developed a web application that can teach CRISPR gRNA design to students and test them by having them go through examples for multiple human genes
Developed and managed the backend by handling how users login and have it be verified as students from a specific University of Toronto class
Developed and managed a database which can be downloaded from the front-end for a specific class' section by the administrators
Manage the hosting, analytics and bugs

efp-seq-browser.name: eFP-Seq Browser
efp-seq-browser.description: An RNA-Seq based gene expression visualizer web-tool
responsibilities: Join the project half-way through and was able to quickly pick-up and improve upon the existing bioinformatics web-application
Working on the existing platform, ensured the accuracy and reliability of the statistical outputs for RNA-Seq analysis
Designed and developed a system which takes users custom RNA-Seq BAM files (that are hosted on Amazon AWS S3 or a personal Google Drive) and have its gene expression and read maps visualized
Focus on accessibility features to ensure that eFP-Seq Browser can be used by as many people as possible, including those with accessibility needs
Ensured eFP-Seq Browser works on mobile
Worked with other researchers to ensure the reliability of statistical outputs for RNA-Seq analysis using both Pearson Correlation Coefficient and point-biserial correction coefficient
Wrote a first-author peer-reviewed scientific publication for the eFP-Seq Browser with Dr. Nicholas Provart

biosensing.name: Gold Biosensing
biosensing.description: Developed a synthetic gene using GolS/GolB to detect aqueous gold
responsibilities: Designed an approved research proposal for the use of E.coli with an inserted synthetic gene involving GolS and GolB to detect an aqueous gold
Did scientific techniques including: freeze-drying, gel extraction, cell lysis, SDS gel staining & SDS page, medium prep, bacterial culturing, PCR and restriction-enzyme (RE) digest & ligation
Managed a team of 9 laboratory researchers, including training
Managed purchases and finances, as well as communication with external sources for sponsorship/grants
Ensured safety protocols and training were known by all researchers
Worked with and assisted a dry lab to quantify the amount of aqueous gold based on colorimetric
Successfully was able to detect aqueous gold up to 0.5uM efficiently and submitted our research and synthetic gene to the iGEM Jamboree 2016 overgrad and won bronze

smalldevtalk.name: Small Dev Talk
smalldevtalk.description: News, interviews and showcases of the latest in the indie scene
responsibilities: Designed and coded the website/blog
Journalist
Handled the Google Ads and finances
Managed social media and communications

mai-tutor.name: Mai Tutor
mai-tutor.description: Tutor for students between grade 1 to 11 in math, science, English, music, geography, and business
responsibilities: Tutored students between grade 1 through 1 in math, science, English, music, geography and business
Gave free extra hours to students in need
